other_tests.findings: Sessile polyps, measuring 3 mm in diameter, were detected in the sigmoid colon and the descending colon. A noncircumferential, nonobstructing mass with rolled borders and an ulcerated base was visible in the ascending colon.

Histologic evaluation of the biopsy specimens of the mass showed ulcerated mucosa with extensive granulation tissue, evidence of acute and chronic inflammation, and reactive changes including numerous plasma cells and histiocytes.
Histologic examination of the resected tissue showed eosinophils, transmural fibrosis, and vascular channels with necrotizing inflammation, confirming A. costaricensis infection.

other_tests.procedure_name: Interferon-Î³ release assay for Mycobacterium tuberculosis
